(iv)THE UNCERTAINTYRELATION 
The two uncertainties  $(\boldsymbol{\cal M}\boldsymbol{q}$  and  $\varDelta\phi)$  obtained in the last subsection seem to show a reciprocal relation. Namely, according to Eqs. (59.14) and (59.17),respectively, 

$$
\begin{array}{l}{{\displaystyle{\cal A}q=\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}\,\delta}}\\ {{\displaystyle{\cal A}p=\left(\frac{h}{2\pi}\right)\frac{1}{\delta\sqrt{2}}\,.}}\end{array}
$$
 
That is,  $\varDelta q$  is proportional to  $\pmb{\delta}$  while  $\varDelta\phi$  is to  $1/\delta$  Therefore, an effort to reduce  $\varDelta q$  inevitably causes an increase in  $\varDelta\phi$  and vice versa 
From Eq. (59.20) we find that 

$$
\varDelta\phi\cdot\varDelta q={\textstyle{\frac{1}{2}}}{\frac{h}{2\pi}}\,,
$$
